newsitem.title: USA: Glickman - Russia interested U.S. wheat, wheat flour.
newsitem.headline: Glickman - Russia interested U.S. wheat, wheat flour.

text.p: U.S. Agriculture Secretary Dan Glickman Monday said Russia expressed interest in making some purchases of U.S. wheat and perhaps wheat flour during last week's semi-annual Gore-Chernomyrdin commission meetings.
"There is some interest, they've mentioned it to me and we're going to follow up on it," Glickman told reporters at a briefing before his upcoming trip to South Africa.

Glickman said the two sides agreed that USDA General Sales Manager Chris Goldthwait and other USDA officials would be in contact with Russian grain buyers to talk further. He said the purchases would be private.

Asked if U.S. export credits under the GSM programs were discussed, Glickman said "generically it was discussed. No specific arrangements, but I think it was anticipated that we would talk about the GSM."
